data.title: Original taste!
data.text: We went there with friends. First impression was a little bit mixed. The entrance is dark and not very welcoming. But as we entered, we were surprised how huge the place is. Their range of entrees is great and we really liked it. Our friend lived a while in Peru and said, their food was really original.

data.title: Yum! Something different.
data.text: Lovely Peruvian food in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. There is a really fine selection of seafood dishes to choose from. Very friendly staff. I will definitely return.

data.title: Delicious!!!!!!
data.text: Best Peruvian food!!!!!!  Wide assortment of items on the menu!  Gracious hosts. You will not be disappointed if you go.

data.title: In search of Peru
data.text: For so many years we have passed by this place right across from Sequoia High School.  My husband wanted to try Peruvian food, and not knowing what to expect we entered Estampas.  I was about to turn around to leave........the restaurant was dark, the decorations kind of kitschy and there was only one other couple in the whole place at 7:00pm.  I am glad my husband convinced me to stay, because the food was delicious.  We started with Anticuchos...wonderful.  Then, my husband and I split the saltado de pollo.  It also was delicious .  There was so much food that we had to box up the leftovers.  A great find!

data.title: Delicious Peruvian Food!
data.text: I go here for the lunch specials which offer such good value.  You can have the specials with either soup or salad.  I always choose the chicken soup which is extraordinarily good.  Obviously created from scratch, the broth hits the spot unlike any other made from scratch chicken soup I've tasted.  Lunch specials are complete meals with made from scratch bread that is crunchy on the outside and incredibly soft on the inside.  There's always a generous serving of whipped butter to go with it.  Tuesdays is Stewed Beef on Rice with Beans and some kind of pickled veggies (onions) .. The Stewed Beef is incredibly soft and melts in your mouth.  So good!  As if this is not enough, you also get a cup of coffee to go with the lunch.  Great value for about $10.

data.title: So-So
data.text: The intention was to have a good Peruvian dessert.........Not having the dessert "Suspiro Limeño" in a Peruvian restaurant is a fail.

data.title: Sad and awful
data.text: We truly wanted to enjoy this ace but the lomo soltado was basically inedible.. I could not chew and swallow the tough, awful beef. We had recently been to Loma & hoped to enjoy some Peruvian food.. It did not happen. They also dud not have the wine i ordered .. One of only 5 they offered. Sadly, this place is a loser.

data.title: Finally! Anticuchos like they make in Peru!
data.text:
I lived for a couple of years in Peru -- and, while it took me a little while to acclimate to the food, once I did,  I was hooked. The memory of that food is usually badly betrayed by "Peruvian" or "South American" restaurants run by people who have no business running a restaurant. 

NOT so at Estampas Peruanas. Our party of six (three of us have lived in Peru) went for a reunion. The restaurant has lots of Peruvian artisan pieces on the walls, simple tables & chairs and the waiter who took care of us was attentive without being intrusive -- my favorite kind of service! 

When the appetizers arrived, I picked up an anticucho skewer with little hope that it would be as good as my memories -- and was so happy that it was EXACTLY right!  After that, I relaxed and enjoyed the Peruvian ceviche (mixed seafood & onions marinated in citrus juice -- some claim original way -- has much bigger chunks than is usually served in North America) .

Several mains were ordered to share, including Lomo Saltado which had just the right combination of meat/peppers/onions/seasonings/potato/rice.  The chicha morada was a tad too sweet (but I always thought it was too sweet!) but nicely flavored with cinnamon. 

Can't speak to the other dishes (tallerines and two kinds of bistek) because after anticuchos, ceviche, and lomo saltado I couldn't eat another bite! But the portions were ENORMOUS. 

Cost for six drinks (beers/chicha), four shared appetizers, and four  shared mains was $170 with taxes/tip included -- so about $28/per person all-in for dinner. We left satisfied!

data.title: This is an absolute neighborhood gem... next to an adult store on El Camino in Redwood City.. Ok.. the location is not...
data.text: This is an absolute neighborhood gem... next to an adult store on El Camino in Redwood City.. Ok.. the location is not the best.. but they serve the best ceviche in the Bay Area (IMHO).  The Peruvian food is spot on.  Love this place..!

data.title: Huge portions. Not easy...
data.text: Huge portions. Not easy to find Peruvian food.

data.title: Not a bad choice if you...
data.text: Not a bad choice if you feel like some Peruvian

data.title: I didn't like it at all
data.text: I didn't like it at all

data.title: Great Place for a Group
data.text: I took my Spanish conversation group here.  We were able to sample a variety of items for a very reasonable price, and are planning to go again.  The food was tasty and the atmosphere pleasant.

data.title: Prompted a trip to Peru
data.text: We have been going to Estampas for several years and because of the great food  and gracious owner, Carlos, this experience prompted us to take a trip to Peru last year. Among our favorite dishes are Ceviche, Anticucho (grilled beef hearts), calamares saltado, paella and anything with fish.  Not only is the food excellent but the price is  reasonable, unlike a $25.95 steak dinner.

data.title: Un pedacito de Perú en el área de la bahía.
data.text:
La comida está buenísima y los anticuchos son de lo mejor. Normalmente pedimos platos clásicos como lomo saltado y tallarines verdes ( con los que no hay pierde) pero el chaufa  de langostinos es un plato que nos sorprendió gratamente. Esperamos regresar y probar los demás platos de la carta. 
El personal  es súper amigable y te hace sentir como en casa.

data.title: Buenos precios
data.text: Platos muy abundantes y sabrosos con excelentes precios. El lugar no es especialmente bonito, falta mucha ambientación. Pero las preparaciones son buenísimas.
